parameter.name: Input image
parameter.description: 3D volume dataset with dimension indicated by the filename (x*y*z), with no header

parameter.name: Output image
parameter.description: Where to store the tracing results. The MDL skeletonization module currently supports output to .vtk or .swc file formats.

parameter.name: Intensity threshold
parameter.description: Determine the background regions we are not interested in and set all the voxels below it to zero. Use higher values for high background intensities.

parameter.name: Connected components size
parameter.description: Used to remove objects smaller than this volume size. Use higher values for larger noisy objects.

parameter.name: Vector magnitude
parameter.description: This is a threshold value used to choose critical points. When the image intensity gradient magnitude is higher than this threshold, a critical points is detected.

parameter.name: IW-MST edge range
parameter.description: If the distance between 2 points is above this distance, we assume there is no edge between them in the graph structure before generating the IW-MST. Use higher values for a more connected graph.

parameter.name: Graph prune size
parameter.description: Prune the tree structure when the trivial branches are shorter than this length. Use higher values to prune longer branches.

parameter.name: Graph morph strength
parameter.description: In graph morphological method with iteration of graph erosion and dilation steps, We set the morphology strength as the number of iterations for graph erosion and dilation. Use higher values to remove longer branches.

parameter.name: MDL weight factor alpha
parameter.description: Used to emphasize the function of either model description or the data description (tradeoff between coverage and conciseness). Use higher values for more complex models.
